page.title: 02FARMING IN BISHOP MIDDLEHAM
page.content:
Most of the surrounding area is farmland and used for the growing of crops. Barley, corn and rape are the most common crops grown.
Many of the farms have animals and these are usually sheep and cattle. The sheep are reared for their wool, being sheared twice a year. Farmers can expect to shear fleeces of around 3 kilos in weight. A good price for this would be Â£1.20 a kilo. The sheep in this area are marked with blue or red dye for identification.
Most of the farmers sell potatoes and some sell eggs.
